meanings.definition: To arrange or schedule a series of events or activities
meanings.sent1: She programed the daily tasks for the team.
meanings.sent2: He programed the alarm clock to wake him up at 7 AM.
meanings.sent3: The cat programed her nap time right after lunch.
meanings.sent4: The teacher programed the students for success with a detailed study plan.
meanings.sent5: The event planner programed the party to run smoothly from start to finish.

meanings.definition: To provide a computer or other machine with coded instructions for the automatic performance of a particular task
meanings.sent1: They programed the robot to move in a zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent2: The technician programed the software to update automatically.
meanings.sent3: The toaster seemed to have been programed to burn every toast.
meanings.sent4: The car's GPS was programed to guide the driver home.
meanings.sent5: The smart thermostat was programed to adjust the temperature based on the time of day.
